IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO MANAGE AND SUPPORT THE MEMPHIS ZOO AND AQUARIUM IN ITS EFFORTS TO PRESERVE WILDLIFE THROUGH EDUCATION, CONSERVATION AND RESEARCH.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE MEMPHIS ZOOLOGICAL SOCIETY IS BUILDING ONE OF THE WORLD'S GREAT ZOOS IN MEMPHIS. OUR STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS ARE DEDICATED TO PROVIDING A NATURALISTIC AND ENRICHING SANCTUARY FOR OUR ANIMALS AND A CLEAN, FRIENDLY, ENTERTAINING, AND EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE FOR OUR GUESTS.
IRS990.Description: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES WERE INCURRED IN THE ACCOMPLISHMENT OF THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES:TO ACT AS A MANAGER OF THE MEMPHIS ZOO. TO WORK TOWARD MAKING THE MEMPHIS ZOO THE MAJOR METROPOLITAN ZOO THAT THE CITY OF MEMPHIS NEEDS AND DESERVES.TO ENGAGE IN FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGNS AND PROGRAMS TO PROVIDE CAPITAL FUNDS FROM THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS FOR THE ENLARGEMENTS AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE MEMPHIS ZOO.TO BE PRIMARILY RESPONSIBLE FOR MANAGING, MARKETING AND PROMOTING THE MEMPHIS ZOO AND FOR RAISING FUNDS FROM THE PRIVATE SECTOR FOR USE IN ACTIVIITES AND THE OPERATION OF THE MEMPHIS ZOO.TO ACT AS A STEWARD FOR THE FUNDS RAISED IN THE PRIVATE SECTOR BY THE MEMPHIS ZOOLOGICAL SOCIETY AND TO ASSURE THE PROPER AND EFFICIENT APPLICATION OF SUCH FUNDS FOR THE OPERATION AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE MEMPHIS ZOO.TO SUPPORT THE EDUCATIONAL, RECREATIONAL AND CONSERVATION PROGRAMS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE MEMPHIS ZOO.IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE CITY OF MEMPHIS AND the city of MEMPHIS PARKs department, TO ENGAGE IN LONG RANGE PLANNING FOR THE MEMPHIS ZOO, ESPECIALLY TOWARDS ADOPTION, IMPLEMENTATION AND COMPLETION OF SUCH MASTER PLAN OR PLANS AS THE CITY OF MEMPHIS, the city of MEMPHIS PARKs department AND THE MEMPHIS ZOOLOGICAL SOCIETY MAY MUTUALLY APPROVE.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: all income is reinvested and the society has no current plans to use any part of the income or capital other than for long-term investment. this policy is reviewed periodically by the society. if that practice ends, such income may then be expended for general (unrestricted) purposes, subject to any constraints in gift instruments.
specific cost of resale items: 866591. special event expenses: 575084.
specific cost of resale items: 866591. special event expenses: 575084.

AcctsActvsOutUSTable.SpecificServicesProvided: payments to the chinese party to support chinese conservation projects for the giant panda.

GrantsToOrgsOutsideUS.PurposeOfGrant: remote sensing of giant panda populations

Form990ScheduleFPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants Outside the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleFPartIV.Explanation: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2: External Organizations that have received grants from the Memphis Zoo were by invitation only. Each institution submits a grant for internal approval during May of each year and all the projects are tied to our giant panda program and ESA permit from USFWS. Expenses are paid as cost reimbursable and we recieve quarterly invoices from each institution.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: nutrition grants and remote sensing grants

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: External Organizations that have received grants from the Memphis Zoo were by invitation only. Each institution submits a grant for internal approval during May of each year and all the projects are tied to our giant panda program and ESA permit from USFWS. Expenses are paid as cost reimbursable and we recieve quarterly invoices from each institution.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: VP at suntrust bank which is the Zoo's primary bank.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: The organization uses a broker to sell stock that is donated.

Note: A $15,000 stock donation that was received during the fiscal year in satisfaction of a prior year pledge has been included on Part I, line 9 of this Schedule M as well as on Form 990, page 9, part VIII, line 1g. The $15,000 stock donation was not included on Schedule B for this year because the donor and the donor's pledge were reported on Schedule B in the year the pledge was made.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: the form 990 is prepared by dixon hughes and then reviewed by the officers of the zoo and the board of directors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The policy is distributed to all new employees and new board directors. the policy is also available on our intranet. in addition, request inquiries are made.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: a committee is convened by the chairman of the board to consider and decide on the compensation of the president of the zoo based on evaluations of similar nonprofit organizations, including but not limited to other zoos. the chairman of the board sends a letter to the cao of the zoo with the decision made regarding the zoo president's salary.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: governing documents and audited financial statements are available upon request and are also on file with the city of memphis parks department. The 990 is on guidestar and is also available upon request. the conflict of interest policy is available upon request or on the memphis zoological intranet.
The finance committee selects and assumes responsibility for oversight of the audit. The finance committee is selected from the board of directors. this process has not changed from the prior year.
